dcterms:creator: Joel Tetreault
Daniel Blanchard
Aoife Cahill
dcterms:description: The TOEFL11 corpus is used for training and testing the NLI system, containing essays from 11 languages, with a total of 11,000 training essays and 1,100 development essays for each language.
dcterms:title: TOEFL11 Corpus

dcterms:creator: Shervin Malmasi
Keelan Evanini
Aoife Cahill
Joel Tetreault
Robert Pugh
Christopher Hamill
Diane Napolitano
Yao Qian
dcterms:description: The data consists of essays from the same 11 L1s, with the test data drawn from a similar distribution as the original TOEFL11 corpus, including written text, transcripts of speech, and i-vector acoustic features.
dcterms:title: NLI 2017 Shared Task Data

dcterms:creator: Lawrence Philips
dcterms:description: The Carnegie Mellon University Pronouncing Dictionary provides a lookup for the pronunciation of known words, which is utilized in the experiments.
dcterms:title: Carnegie Mellon University Pronouncing Dictionary (CMU)

dcterms:creator: Moshe Koppel
Jonathan Schler
Kir Zigdon
dcterms:description: The dataset contains transcripts of speech and i-vector acoustic features, which are included in the data release for dialect identification.
dcterms:title: Speech Transcripts and i-vector Acoustic Features
